title: Apple Support need the pathway to our profile on Time Machine
content: Apple Support are restoring one of our iMacs after a total rebuild. They need to go into our Time Machine backup and find the pathway to the P-list (?) to restore our profile to a newly downloaded copy of Firefox. We cannot risk migrating a complete copy of the old Firefox in case of corruption. Hopefully, that explains the problem? Many thanks.
creator: haddondavies

title: Zoom with touchpad Ctrl+glide in Windows as I can in linux Ubuntu
content:
Hi SuMo I'm not a big fan of mouse/touchpad when browsing, I rather like keyboard shortcuts, e.g. Ctrl+K, W and so on. Although, my boss recently lent me a windows laptop (which brings me back in the years) and I noticed I felt borrowed I could not zoom in/out with the touchpad Ctrl+2-fingers-glide like I can do I linux and like Ctrl+mouse Wheel. I know I can Ctrl+[+/-/0] but this is a keyboard feature, and also pinch with the touchpad*, but Ctrl+2-fingers-glide seems to me the natural intuitive sister of Ctrl+Wheel and is very convenient when reading a page where scroll has yet same equivalent for both pointing devices, namely simple wheel and simple 2-fingers-glide.

  • this is fingersache when we have palm sat on the desktop in front of the touchpad, so this question can eventually fall in accessibility features request. Pinch is just a thing for touch-screens.

Any chance we see this feature in Windows soon or is there already a hidden feature (I already searched about:config for zoom without success). BTW, some other apps work this way : MSO, LO, GIMP etc.. both in Win & nuxes for the 2 laters.

Thanks guys for years of quiet browsing.
creator: f0rhum

title: Multiple entries for webpages

Is there a way to do this that I missed or could this be developed as such? Best regards

title: My Bookmarks Multiply in the Hundreds and Can't Be Deleted
content: OK, so I tried control+shift+B and got zero results I clicked on the bookmark menu I clicked on the top item I wanted to remove there was no "right panel" I could delete only one item, but then it populated itself at the bottom of the list After every entry of mine into the bookmark library, it multiplied. I now have over 7000 bookmarks and they crash Mozilla.
creator: smadar.lavie18

title: My Bookmarks Multiply in the Hundreds and Can't Be Deleted
content: I have followed all the instructions re how to delete bookmarks. Nothing works. Each time I try to mark all and delete - they multiply - by doubles or triples -- and then the whole Mozilla crashes. This happened to me with Chrome, and by now I have over 50,000 chrome bookmarks. I have uninstalled chrome, installed Mozilla and it is the only online platform on my laptop now. For some odd reason, several sets of my Chrome bookmarks showed up on the Mozilla. I made sure that nothing is syncing. I still can't delete all the bookmarks. Only one by one. And if I delete one, it adds itself at the bottom of the list. I'm in deep despair. It's probably a malware that my Norton does not detect.
creator: smadar.lavie18

title: Firefox vs Edge; Google
content:
Hello,

I have used Firefox as my default browser for years and I've been very happy with it. Now it seems as though I'm almost being "pushed" into using Edge with Windows 10. What I need is some encouragement to continue to use Firefox. That means I need some very good reasons to keep using Firefox instead switching to Edge as my default browser.

Having said that I just tried to italicize the word "pushed" in the paragraph above and it did not work. Then I tried to make it bold and that didn't work either. Does anyone know the answer to either of these questions?

Last question. Is it possible to get Google out of my life?? Everywhere I turn it's Google, Google, Google ....

title: How to use different themes on different computers but still sync all FF data?
content:
Hello, Is there a way to use a different theme on one machine (light) and use the dark theme on a different computer but still be able to sync the data?

I have tried this from a previous question https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1242818

Set services.sync.prefs.sync.lightweightThemes to False, but this does not work.

Did it on both macOS machines, closed and restarted the browser, and changing the theme on one browser ends up changing the theme on the other machine.

Is there any way to have to separate themes on two different machines?

Thank you!
creator: muzzle

title: Download "Partial" Files Split Problem
content:
I have had this problem many times and for a long time, ever since starting to use Firefox again (SEE Image $20210320-mar~3-Download-Partial_Split_Problem.jpg).

I end up with 2 Dwnlded Files; 1 file ending in ".exe", but with a 0 KB File size, and another file ending in ".exe.part", with the file size that the Dwnlded file should have, in this case, 622 MB. I have no wish to "fudge" a fix, by renaming the file with a size of 622 MB, in case this causes corruption, or maybe down the line.

I would like a "real" fix, so the problem does not occur in the 1st place.

dupe. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1329914
creator: IHTurbo

title: Downloaded File with 0 KB File Size
content:
A downloaded file (VMware-workstation-full-16.1.0-17198959.exe), Dwnlded on 19/Mar/21, ended up with a file size of 0 KB (SEE Image $20210320-mar~1-Download_Final_File_Size=0KB.jpg).

The file size should have been 622 MB (SEE Image $20210320-mar~2-Download_Save-File_Size.jpg).

I was wondering if the file ending in ".exe.part" may have been mistakenly accepted as the real file & renamed to ".exe".
creator: IHTurbo
